title: Ivan Rakitic 'open to offers to leave Barcelona with Manchester United and Juventus keen'
text:
Ivan Rakitic is getting closer to the exit door at Barcelona as it is becoming more evident he is not part of Ernesto Valverde's plan at Nou Camp.

The Catalan club received multiple offers for the midfielder in the summer with links between the Croatian and Paris Saint-Germain, but now a link to the Premier League could be on the cards.

The 31-year-old has revealed he is 'open to offers' from Manchester United and Juventus after getting a lack of game time in Spain, per Marca.

Ivan Rakitic has fallen out of favour at Barcelona and is 'open to offers' for a January transfer

Rakitic has featured for just 206 minutes over Barcelona's 12 matches with the youthful Frenkie De Jong and Barcelona academy product Sergio Busquets the preferred midfield options.

This has left the Croatian riding the bench alongside Arturo Vidal which is fueling the potential exit.

Manchester United are having midfield problems this season under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, with Fred and Nemanja Matic under performing along with Paul Pogba's injury woes. In an effort to bolster this position, the club are also reportedly targeting a shock move for Leeds midfielder Kalvin Phillips.

Juventus are in a slightly different predicament as they have plenty of talented central midfield options with the likes of Aaron Ramsey, Miralem Pjanic and Blaise Matuidi to name a few.

Rakitic's contract at Barcelona runs out in June 2021 but Valverde is likely to let him go this January.
